chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: Welcome to the Pidgin User's Guide! It's our hope that this guide will address a number of concerns about Pidgin lacking user documentation.

To get started, let's summarize some of Pidgin's features:
Multiprotocol support:
AOL Instant Messenger (AIM)
Bonjour (formerly Rendezvous)
Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP, formerly Jabber)
Gadu-Gadu
Google Talk (this is XMPP with some additional extensions)
ICQ
Internet Relay Chat (IRC)
MyspaceIM
Novell Groupwise Messenger
QQ
Sametime
Secure Internet Live Conferencing (SILC)
SIP/SIMPLE (we call this SIMPLE)
Windows Live Messenger (formerly MSN; we call it MSN)
Yahoo! Messenger (we call this Yahoo)
Zephyr
Buddy icons (avatars)
Offline messaging on numerous protocols
Combining multiple buddies into a single Contact
Ability to use multiple IM accounts at the same time, even multiple accounts using the same protocol
Support for "Current Media" or "User Tune" on protocols supporting it
Multiple conversations in a single window using a tabbed interface
Multi-user Chats (MUCs) on all protocols which support them
A flexible plugin system allowing the addition or modification of features
Smiley themes which can change the appearance of default smileys
Status messages on all protocols which support them
File transfer on numerous protocols
Display of buddy icons (avatars) on buddy list window
Comprehensive and flexible status system
Ability to add multi-user chats to the buddy list for convenient access to frequently used chatrooms
Configurable sound notifications for numerous events

Now let's take a look at running Pidgin for the first time. We'll make the assumption that you already know how to find and launch Pidgin by using a shell or a graphical menu system such as Windows' Start menu or an X11 window manager's application menus. When you first launch Pidgin, you'll see something similar to the figure below:
Pidgin First Launch Window
As the window says, you need to configure accounts. We'll cover that in several chapters covering creating an account for each protocol.
